programme.title: Brussels, My Love?
programme.desc: From the economy to the climate and the EU's role in world affairs, this talk show sheds light on European affairs and the issues that impact on our daily lives as Europeans.

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: (2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. A bodged heist sees two brothers try to evade the LAPD in a hospital wagon, as a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.

programme.title: Little Monsters
programme.desc: (2019) Undead comedy horror with Lupita Nyong'o. Can an infantile slacker, a diligent teacher and a deranged children's TV presenter rescue a school trip from a zombie outbreak? Head count!

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: (1986) Four young friends (Wil Wheaton, River Phoenix, Corey Feldman, Jerry O'Connell) set out on an expedition into deepest Oregon in this coming-of-age tale based on a Stephen King story.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy starring Faye Dunaway and Rupert Everett. A hotel owner's attempt to upgrade her star rating is undermined by the arrival of a master thief and his light-fingered orangutan.

programme.title: The War with Grandpa
programme.desc: (2020) Raucous family comedy starring Robert De Niro, Uma Thurman and Oakes Fegley. A grandpa gets embroiled in a prank war with his grandson when he moves into the family home.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: (1992) Comedy starring Whoopi Goldberg. A casino singer who witnesses a Mob murder goes into hiding at a convent, where she soon has the choir rocking. With Maggie Smith.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy-drama starring Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep. A naive young woman lands a job as assistant to one of New York's most important, but ruthless and cynical, magazine editors.

programme.title: The Greatest Showman
programme.desc: (2017) Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron and Michelle Williams star in the Golden-Globe-winning, toe-tapping smash hit musical about the life and times of P.T. Barnum, the creator of the circus.

programme.title: The King's Man
programme.desc: (2021) The spy-caper franchise continues with the origins story of the Kingsman agency, as a plucky group battle an international conspiracy at the outbreak of WWI. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: (2018) Tense horror starring John Krasinski and Emily Blunt. A family struggle to survive when the world's overrun by vicious blind aliens who can hear even the slightest whimper.

programme.title: In Bruges
programme.desc: (2008) Comedy-drama. Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson star as Irish hitmen who are banished to Belgium by their boss after they botch a job. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy starring Robin Williams and Sally Field. A struggling actor dresses as a woman to get his estranged wife to hire him as a housekeeper, so he can spend more time with his kids.

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: (2010) Family fantasy comedy. Dwayne Johnson stars as a tough ice hockey player who is transformed into a real-life fairy as punishment for telling a child that tooth fairies don't exist.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: (2011) The third movie in the sci-fi action franchise. The discovery of a spacecraft on the dark side of the moon sparks another battle between the Autobots and the Decepticons.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: (2009) JJ Abrams's sci-fi adventure reboot, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Zoe Saldana. A vengeful time traveller targets Kirk and Spock on their first mission.

programme.title: Honest Thief
programme.desc: (2020) Action thriller starring Liam Neeson as a notorious bank robber. He wants to give it all up for love but is cheated by corrupt FBI agents. Can he clear his name and get the girl?

programme.title: A Quiet Place Part II
programme.desc: (2020) Hushed-horror sequel with Emily Blunt and Cillian Murphy. Armed only with a hearing aid, can the family evade the vicious aliens with super-hearing, and find a community to live in?

programme.title: The Long Good Friday
programme.desc: (1980) Bob Hoskins and Helen Mirren star in John MacKenzie's East London gangster thriller. Gang leader Hoskins' hold over his empire is under threat.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Baby's Day Out
programme.desc: (1994) Comedy starring Joe Mantegna, Joe Pantoliano and Brian Haley. Inept criminals kidnap a millionaire's baby. But when the boy escapes, there's mayhem as they try to track him down.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: (1995) Classic 90s high-school re-imagining of Jane Austen's Emma. Two fashion-obsessed pals (Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash) transform a new girl (Brittany Murphy) but create a monster.

programme.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure
programme.desc: (2005) Fantasy adventure from the world of Jumanji. A mysterious board game plunges two brothers deep into space, where dangerous aliens lurk.

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: (1988) Dark Christmas comedy. Bill Murray stars in this take on Dickens' classic as a misanthropic TV executive whose life is turned around by three very different Christmas ghosts.

programme.title: Finding Your Feet
programme.desc: (2017) Comedy starring Imelda Staunton as a posh woman who goes to live with her sister on a housing estate after discovering her husband has been having an affair with her best friend.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum
programme.desc: (2019) Keanu Reeves returns for the third time as the supposedly retired hitman. This time, someone's put a contract on John Wick's head and only a mystic in Morocco can lift it.

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: (2002) Action-thriller starring Jason Statham. For a price, an underworld courier will deliver people or packages anywhere, no questions asked. But one job lands him in deep danger.

programme.title: The King's Man
programme.desc: (2021) The spy-caper franchise continues with the origins story of the Kingsman agency, as a plucky group battle an international conspiracy at the outbreak of WWI. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: (2018) Tense horror starring John Krasinski and Emily Blunt. A family struggle to survive when the world's overrun by vicious blind aliens who can hear even the slightest whimper.

programme.title: In Bruges
programme.desc: (2008) Comedy-drama. Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson star as Irish hitmen who are banished to Belgium by their boss after they botch a job. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy starring Robin Williams and Sally Field. A struggling actor dresses as a woman to get his estranged wife to hire him as a housekeeper, so he can spend more time with his kids.

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: (2010) Family fantasy comedy. Dwayne Johnson stars as a tough ice hockey player who is transformed into a real-life fairy as punishment for telling a child that tooth fairies don't exist.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: (2011) The third movie in the sci-fi action franchise. The discovery of a spacecraft on the dark side of the moon sparks another battle between the Autobots and the Decepticons.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: (2009) JJ Abrams's sci-fi adventure reboot, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Zoe Saldana. A vengeful time traveller targets Kirk and Spock on their first mission.

programme.title: Honest Thief
programme.desc: (2020) Action thriller starring Liam Neeson as a notorious bank robber. He wants to give it all up for love but is cheated by corrupt FBI agents. Can he clear his name and get the girl?

programme.title: A Quiet Place Part II
programme.desc: (2020) Hushed-horror sequel with Emily Blunt and Cillian Murphy. Armed only with a hearing aid, can the family evade the vicious aliens with super-hearing, and find a community to live in?

programme.title: The Long Good Friday
programme.desc: (1980) Bob Hoskins and Helen Mirren star in John MacKenzie's East London gangster thriller. Gang leader Hoskins' hold over his empire is under threat.

programme.title: Baby's Day Out

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: (1995) Classic 90s high-school re-imagining of Jane Austen's Emma. Two fashion-obsessed pals (Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash) transform a new girl (Brittany Murphy) but create a monster.

programme.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure

programme.title: Martin Lewis: How to Win at Board Games
programme.desc: The money-saving expert shares his favourite hobby and reveals the hidden tips, tactics and strategies that help him come out victorious when he plays board games before taking on a world champion in his favourite game, Scrabble

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which two celebrity captains lead contestants on a mission to draw images that match a word or phrase from a specific category, with their team-mates having to guess correctly to score. In the first edition, Mel is joined by Denise Van Outen and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen

programme.title: Inside M&S at Christmas
programme.desc: Cameras are invited inside every corner of high street giant Marks & Spencer during its busiest time of year. In Bristol, staff prepare to open a brand new store and there's a behind-the-scenes look at the creation of this year's experimental Christmas sandwich and the world's first snowing chocolate box

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: It's a Wonderful Life
programme.desc: Frank Capra's classic fantasy drama, starring James Stewart, Donna Reed and Lionel Barrymore. George Bailey is a small-town businessman who believes he has been a failure. Contemplating suicide, George meets his guardian angel and discovers what life in his home town of Bedford Falls would have been like had he never lived.

programme.title: Royal Carols: Together at Christmas
programme.desc: The Princess of Wales hosts a special Christmas carol service at Westminster Abbey, supported by The Royal Foundation, to recognise and celebrate the incredible work of individuals and organisations across the nation who have stepped up to support their communities

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Susanna Reid, Ed Balls and Kate Garraway present a Christmas morning special, including music by Michael Ball and Alfie Boe, a performance by the cast of The Lion King and a reunion of Pride of Britain best friends Jacob Newson and Florrie Bark. The team also crown the winner of this year's 1 Million Minutes Len Goodman Award

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: It's a family affair for Lorraine as she is joined by granddaughter Billie, as well Corrie actress Jane Danson and social media sensation KSI. She also performs Love is All Around with Marti Pellow, and Ross King chats to Katy Perry

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Cat Deeley, Alison Hammond and Dermot O'Leary host a festive special, with a festive poem from Gyles Brandreth, an interview with Love Actually actress and singer Olivia Olsen and Josie Gibson as the 'festive fizz fairy'. Phil Vickery is also on hand with tips on how to spruce up any sides being served with dinner, from sprouts to stuffing

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas Day
programme.desc: The chef invites Lorraine Kelly, Craig David and Luke Evans into his home for a festive feast put together by himself, Lise Goodwin-Allen and Richard Bertinet that includes langoustines, monk fish, choux pastry, chicken Diane, rum babas and the ultimate Christmas cheeseboard. Plus, music by Marti Pellow

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: His Majesty Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth

programme.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
programme.desc: Sequel to the hit comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern. After becoming separated from his family en route to a Christmas holiday in Florida, Kevin McCallister finds himself alone in New York, where he's destined to meet two old enemies.

programme.title: Bullseye Christmas Special
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff hosts a revival of the darts-themed game show in which three teams of two, made up of an amateur darts player and a quiz-loving partner, combine their skills to win points and prizes. All the classic rounds are back including the Category Board, Pounds for Points and Bully's Prize Board, and the winning team has a big decision to make at the end of the show - will they risk everything they've won so far to try to win the mystery star prize? Also joining in the fun is teenage professional Luke Littler, who partners up with Freddie to try to complete a charity challenge

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon is in for a shock, there is evidence of a struggle at Home Farm and joy for Belle

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: It remains to be seen whether Gail will depart Weatherfield a married woman, Adam suffers a festive fall, and Daniel's proposal takes Bethany by surprise. Seasonal goodwill is in short supply for Nick, Toyah and Leanne

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Christmas Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as actor Tony Maudsley, Olympic trampoline champion Bryony Page, actress Kerry Godliman and Pointless presenter Alexander Armstrong take on one of Britain's finest quizzing brains, hoping to win money for their chosen charities. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Downton Abbey: A New Era
programme.desc: Period drama sequel starring Hugh Bonneville, Elizabeth McGovern and Maggie Smith. It's 1928, and Downton Abbey has been chosen as the setting for a new silent film, much to the excitement of the staff. Meanwhile, the Crawleys set off for the South of France, where the Dowager Countess is set to come into possession of a glamorous villa.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: His Majesty Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance 2024
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr host the gala evening at the Royal Albert Hall, in the presence of King Charles. Featuring the cast of Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical Starlight Express, magicians Penn & Teller and Britain's Got Talent winner Sydnie Christmas, as well as Sophie Ellis-Bextor, James Bay and Eurovision 2024 winner Nemo

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September of this year, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: His Majesty Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Mariah Carey: Merry Christmas to All
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter performs a repertoire of her festive holiday hits, including the chart-topping favourite 'All I Want for Christmas Is You'.

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas Day
programme.desc: The chef invites Lorraine Kelly, Craig David and Luke Evans into his home for a festive feast put together by himself, Lise Goodwin-Allen and Richard Bertinet that includes langoustines, monk fish, choux pastry, chicken Diane, rum babas and the ultimate Christmas cheeseboard. Plus, music by Marti Pellow

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring George Lazenby, Diana Rigg and Telly Savalas. James Bond resigns from the Secret Service in order to continue his relentless quest to track down arch villain Blofeld. A liaison with a beautiful but wilful playgirl leads Bond to a notorious criminal who helps him track his quarry to a mountain hideaway in Switzerland.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the King George VI Chase from Kempton Park. Plus, the Rowland Meyrick Chase from Wetherby and the Formby Hurdle from Aintree. With analysis from AP McCoy, Mick Fitzgerald and Ruby Walsh, reports from Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Musical based on the hit stage show, starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John. Unexpectedly reunited with summer love Danny at her new high school, Sandy Olsson can't believe how different he is. Can the new Danny Zuko, the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-birds, really be the boy she met down at the beach? Perhaps Frenchy and Rizzo, both members of the super-cool Pink Ladies gang, can help her develop some street cred to win back his heart.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Jeff Brazier and Scarlett Moffatt as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon struggles, there is trouble at Home Farm, and Cain sets aside his worries

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: The 1% Club Christmas Special
programme.desc: Festive edition of Lee Mack's quiz, in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin the show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Bruce Willis. When a rogue former government agent threatens to bring the United States computer infrastructure to its knees, it falls to cop John McClane and a young hacker to prevent potential disaster. But can the mix of old-school, tough-guy policing and modern computer expertise foil a group that will stop at nothing?

programme.title: Gallagher Premiership Unleashed
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, featuring Gloucester v Harlequins, Leicester Tigers v Bristol Bears, Newcastle Falcons v Bath, Sale Sharks v Exeter Chiefs and Saracens v Northampton Saints

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: Evan Almighty
programme.desc: Comedy fantasy sequel starring Steve Carell and Morgan Freeman. Newsman Evan Baxter is newly elected to Congress on a "Save the World" ticket and trying to ignore God's instruction to build an ark. Forced to comply after the Almighty transforms him into a modern-day Noah, Baxter sets out to convince everyone of impending disaster.

programme.title: Big
programme.desc: Comedy starring Tom Hanks. At a fairground fortune-telling booth, 12-year-old Josh Baskin wishes that he could be "big". The next morning he is astonished to find himself fully grown. He soon learns that, in the adult world, being a grown-up is not all that it is cracked up to be.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of two meetings, including the Desert Orchid from Kempton Park and the Welsh Grand National from Chepstow. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman, Sally Ann Grassick and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's blockbuster adventure, starring Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum and Richard Attenborough. Billionaire tycoon John Hammond has built the ultimate theme park - an island populated by genetically engineered dinosaurs. A group of guests, including Hammond's grandchildren, are invited to preview the attraction, touring the park in remotely controlled cars. But, as a tropical storm gathers, an unscrupulous employee shuts down the elaborate security system, leaving the tour stranded - and mayhem about to break loose.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: The Big Quiz: Coronation Street v Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sally Lindsay steps into Stephen Mulhern's shoes to host the annual clash between ITV's biggest soaps. Coronation Street team captain Jack P Shepherd (David Platt) is joined by Samia Longchambon (Maria Connor) and Vinta Morgan (Ronnie Bailey) to take on Emmerdale's Beth Cordingly (Ruby Fox-Miligan), Rebecca Sarker (Manpreet Sharma) and captain Mark Charnock (Marlon Dingle). Teams play rounds that test their knowledge of the past year in soap, guess missing words in You Must Be Blanking, and rummage around in Sally's Soap Box full of props to work out memorable storylines

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ross and Marlon find themselves in danger, Ruby is suspicious, and Lydia is worried

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Amy provides a vital clue when Nick seeks proof of Leanne setting him up, Ken and Cassie swap belated presents, and a newly confident Bethany retrieves her old clothes from Daisy

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: The return of the quiz in which contestants from across the UK take on a team consisting of Paul 'The Sinnerman' Sinha, Jenny 'The Vixen' Ryan, Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty, Shaun 'The Dark Destroyer' Wallace, Mark 'The Beast' Labbett and Darragh 'The Menace' Ennis hoping to win big money. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: Tsunami: The Wave That Shook the World
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 2004 Indian Ocean Boxing Day tsunami. Killing around 230,000 people and displacing 1.4 million more, it was one of the deadliest natural disasters in history. Told through the first-hand experiences of individuals from all over the world, cameras reveal how catastrophic events unfolded during the morning of December 26, 2004. Among them is Rob, an Englishman who conveys the horrifying account of his desperate attempts to rescue his family from a paradise beach in Sri Lanka

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: TikTok: Top 100 2024
programme.desc: A countdown of the top 100 funniest, most extreme and rudest viral videos of 2024 from TikTok and other social media platforms. Plus, an estimation of how much money the clips made for their creators

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Christmas Carols on ITV
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter Louise Redknapp hosts a Christmas Eve celebration from St Elisabeth's Church in Greater Manchester. With appearances from composer Debbie Wiseman, soul singer Mica Paris, 1990s pop legend Chesney Hawkes, soprano Carly Paoli, The D-Day Darlings, Coronation Street star Tanisha Gorey and Brit Award-winner Russell Watson

programme.title: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's blockbuster adventure, starring Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum and Richard Attenborough. Billionaire tycoon John Hammond has built the ultimate theme park - an island populated by genetically engineered dinosaurs. programme.title: Beat the Chasers

programme.title: Tsunami: The Wave That Shook the World
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 2004 Indian Ocean Boxing Day tsunami. Killing around 230,000 people and displacing 1.4 million more, it was one of the deadliest natural disasters in history. Told through the first-hand experiences of individuals from all over the world, cameras reveal how catastrophic events unfolded during the morning of December 26, 2004. Among them is Rob, an Englishman who conveys the horrifying account of his desperate attempts to rescue his family from a paradise beach in Sri Lanka

programme.title: It's a Wonderful Life

programme.title: Royal Carols: Together at Christmas
programme.desc: The Princess of Wales hosts a special Christmas carol service at Westminster Abbey, supported by The Royal Foundation, to recognise and celebrate the incredible work of individuals and organisations across the nation who have stepped up to support their communities

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Susanna Reid, Ed Balls and Kate Garraway present a Christmas morning special, including music by Michael Ball and Alfie Boe, a performance by the cast of The Lion King and a reunion of Pride of Britain best friends Jacob Newson and Florrie Bark. programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: It's a family affair for Lorraine as she is joined by granddaughter Billie, as well Corrie actress Jane Danson and social media sensation KSI. She also performs Love is All Around with Marti Pellow, and Ross King chats to Katy Perry

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Cat Deeley, Alison Hammond and Dermot O'Leary host a festive special, with a festive poem from Gyles Brandreth, an interview with Love Actually actress and singer Olivia Olsen and Josie Gibson as the 'festive fizz fairy'. Phil Vickery is also on hand with tips on how to spruce up any sides being served with dinner, from sprouts to stuffing

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas Day
programme.desc: The chef invites Lorraine Kelly, Craig David and Luke Evans into his home for a festive feast put together by himself, Lise Goodwin-Allen and Richard Bertinet that includes langoustines, monk fish, choux pastry, chicken Diane, rum babas and the ultimate Christmas cheeseboard. Plus, music by Marti Pellow

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: His Majesty Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth

programme.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
programme.desc: Sequel to the hit comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern. After becoming separated from his family en route to a Christmas holiday in Florida, Kevin McCallister finds himself alone in New York, where he's destined to meet two old enemies.

programme.title: Bullseye Christmas Special
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff hosts a revival of the darts-themed game show in which three teams of two, made up of an amateur darts player and a quiz-loving partner, combine their skills to win points and prizes. All the classic rounds are back including the Category Board, Pounds for Points and Bully's Prize Board, and the winning team has a big decision to make at the end of the show - will they risk everything they've won so far to try to win the mystery star prize? Also joining in the fun is teenage professional Luke Littler, who partners up with Freddie to try to complete a charity challenge

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon is in for a shock, there is evidence of a struggle at Home Farm and joy for Belle

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: It remains to be seen whether Gail will depart Weatherfield a married woman, Adam suffers a festive fall, and Daniel's proposal takes Bethany by surprise. Seasonal goodwill is in short supply for Nick, Toyah and Leanne

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Christmas Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as actor Tony Maudsley, Olympic trampoline champion Bryony Page, actress Kerry Godliman and Pointless presenter Alexander Armstrong take on one of Britain's finest quizzing brains, hoping to win money for their chosen charities. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Downton Abbey: A New Era
programme.desc: Period drama sequel starring Hugh Bonneville, Elizabeth McGovern and Maggie Smith. It's 1928, and Downton Abbey has been chosen as the setting for a new silent film, much to the excitement of the staff. Meanwhile, the Crawleys set off for the South of France, where the Dowager Countess is set to come into possession of a glamorous villa.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: His Majesty Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance 2024
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr host the gala evening at the Royal Albert Hall, in the presence of King Charles. Featuring the cast of Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical Starlight Express, magicians Penn & Teller and Britain's Got Talent winner Sydnie Christmas, as well as Sophie Ellis-Bextor, James Bay and Eurovision 2024 winner Nemo

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September of this year, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: His Majesty Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas Day
programme.desc: The chef invites Lorraine Kelly, Craig David and Luke Evans into his home for a festive feast put together by himself, Lise Goodwin-Allen and Richard Bertinet that includes langoustines, monk fish, choux pastry, chicken Diane, rum babas and the ultimate Christmas cheeseboard. programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring George Lazenby, Diana Rigg and Telly Savalas. James Bond resigns from the Secret Service in order to continue his relentless quest to track down arch villain Blofeld. A liaison with a beautiful but wilful playgirl leads Bond to a notorious criminal who helps him track his quarry to a mountain hideaway in Switzerland.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the King George VI Chase from Kempton Park. Plus, the Rowland Meyrick Chase from Wetherby and the Formby Hurdle from Aintree. With analysis from AP McCoy, Mick Fitzgerald and Ruby Walsh, reports from Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Musical based on the hit stage show, starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John. Unexpectedly reunited with summer love Danny at her new high school, Sandy Olsson can't believe how different he is. Can the new Danny Zuko, the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-birds, really be the boy she met down at the beach? Perhaps Frenchy and Rizzo, both members of the super-cool Pink Ladies gang, can help her develop some street cred to win back his heart.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Jeff Brazier and Scarlett Moffatt as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon struggles, there is trouble at Home Farm, and Cain sets aside his worries

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: The 1% Club Christmas Special
programme.desc: Festive edition of Lee Mack's quiz, in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin the show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Bruce Willis. When a rogue former government agent threatens to bring the United States computer infrastructure to its knees, it falls to cop John McClane and a young hacker to prevent potential disaster. But can the mix of old-school, tough-guy policing and modern computer expertise foil a group that will stop at nothing?

programme.title: Gallagher Premiership Unleashed
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, featuring Gloucester v Harlequins, Leicester Tigers v Bristol Bears, Newcastle Falcons v Bath, Sale Sharks v Exeter Chiefs and Saracens v Northampton Saints

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Jeff Brazier and Scarlett Moffatt as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon struggles, there is trouble at Home Farm, and Cain sets aside his worries

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: The 1% Club Christmas Special
programme.desc: Festive edition of Lee Mack's quiz, in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin the show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Bruce Willis. When a rogue former government agent threatens to bring the United States computer infrastructure to its knees, it falls to cop John McClane and a young hacker to prevent potential disaster. But can the mix of old-school, tough-guy policing and modern computer expertise foil a group that will stop at nothing?

programme.title: Gallagher Premiership Unleashed
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, featuring Gloucester v Harlequins, Leicester Tigers v Bristol Bears, Newcastle Falcons v Bath, Sale Sharks v Exeter Chiefs and Saracens v Northampton Saints

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: Evan Almighty
programme.desc: Comedy fantasy sequel starring Steve Carell and Morgan Freeman. Newsman Evan Baxter is newly elected to Congress on a "Save the World" ticket and trying to ignore God's instruction to build an ark. Forced to comply after the Almighty transforms him into a modern-day Noah, Baxter sets out to convince everyone of impending disaster.

programme.title: Big
programme.desc: Comedy starring Tom Hanks. At a fairground fortune-telling booth, 12-year-old Josh Baskin wishes that he could be "big". The next morning he is astonished to find himself fully grown. He soon learns that, in the adult world, being a grown-up is not all that it is cracked up to be.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of two meetings, including the Desert Orchid from Kempton Park and the Welsh Grand National from Chepstow. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman, Sally Ann Grassick and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's blockbuster adventure, starring Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum and Richard Attenborough. Billionaire tycoon John Hammond has built the ultimate theme park - an island populated by genetically engineered dinosaurs. A group of guests, including Hammond's grandchildren, are invited to preview the attraction, touring the park in remotely controlled cars. But, as a tropical storm gathers, an unscrupulous employee shuts down the elaborate security system, leaving the tour stranded - and mayhem about to break loose.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: The Big Quiz: Coronation Street v Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sally Lindsay steps into Stephen Mulhern's shoes to host the annual clash between ITV's biggest soaps. Coronation Street team captain Jack P Shepherd (David Platt) is joined by Samia Longchambon (Maria Connor) and Vinta Morgan (Ronnie Bailey) to take on Emmerdale's Beth Cordingly (Ruby Fox-Miligan), Rebecca Sarker (Manpreet Sharma) and captain Mark Charnock (Marlon Dingle). Teams play rounds that test their knowledge of the past year in soap, guess missing words in You Must Be Blanking, and rummage around in Sally's Soap Box full of props to work out memorable storylines

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ross and Marlon find themselves in danger, Ruby is suspicious, and Lydia is worried

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Amy provides a vital clue when Nick seeks proof of Leanne setting him up, Ken and Cassie swap belated presents, and a newly confident Bethany retrieves her old clothes from Daisy

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: The return of the quiz in which contestants from across the UK take on a team consisting of Paul 'The Sinnerman' Sinha, Jenny 'The Vixen' Ryan, Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty, Shaun 'The Dark Destroyer' Wallace, Mark 'The Beast' Labbett and Darragh 'The Menace' Ennis hoping to win big money. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: Tsunami: The Wave That Shook the World
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 2004 Indian Ocean Boxing Day tsunami. Killing around 230,000 people and displacing 1.4 million more, it was one of the deadliest natural disasters in history. Told through the first-hand experiences of individuals from all over the world, cameras reveal how catastrophic events unfolded during the morning of December 26, 2004. Among them is Rob, an Englishman who conveys the horrifying account of his desperate attempts to rescue his family from a paradise beach in Sri Lanka
